summary: Mary Susan Grimes was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily consist of payroll records and certifications spanning from January 1977 to December 1978, indicating her employment during that period. These records include payroll authorization forms, certificates of relationship to members of Congress, and low earnings reports. Additionally, her name appears on a JFK Assassination System Identification Form related to background checks conducted on HSCA staff and applicants.
significance: Mary Susan Grimes' significance lies in her role as an employee of the HSCA, contributing to the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the HSCA, the payroll records confirm her employment and contribution to the committee's work.
